summary:
Intercultural liaison ‒ communication and cooperation: guidance (advice (European/Anglo-Saxon/Japanese cultures), training (workshops), coaching); projects (cross-border policies: investigation, analysis, liaison); languages English, Dutch, Japanese, French, Swedish, Russian, German

Specialties: Japanese, British and Dutch cultures; languages: English (native and primary language), Dutch (fluent), Japanese (native language), French, Swedish, Russian, German (all operational (Russian and Swedish at university level); international negotiations (banking and insurance regulation at global and European level); financial (supervisory) regulation (banking, insurance; policy conception, negotiation and implementation); financial audit; financial accounting (IFRS); governance

school.name: University of East Anglia, Norwich, UK

education.degree_name: British A- and O-levels, American SATs

profile_positions.description:
Many years of experience in international negotiations relating to financial supervision of banks and insurers through activities in various working groups of the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision (Accounting Task Force), Committee of European Banking Supervisors (now EBA), International Association of Insurance Supervisors, and Committee of European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Supervisors (now EIOPA; including chair of working group on capital).

Many years of experience in preparing and implementing regulatory measures for banks and insurers and the communication of those measures in English and Dutch, including training.

Many years of experience in preparing and checking legal and regulatory texts in English and Dutch; experience in translating from Swedish and Russian into English and vice versa at academic level; experience in translating from Japanese into English at professional level through assisting my father who was a professional translator.

Lifelong experience in operating in various languages: son of a Japanese mother and British father, international school, university study including Swedish and Russian (with study periods in Stockholm and Moscow), international audit work, international regulatory work),
profile_positions.title: Intercultural liaison consultant

company.name: De Nederlandsche Bank / Dutch Central Bank

profile_positions.description:
International negotiations: chair of a working group (Solvency II own funds (capital)) of the former Committee of European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Supervisors; participation in various working groups of the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision, International Association of Insurance Supervisors, the former Committee of European Banking Supervisors and the former Committee of European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Supervisors; representation of the Basel Committee's Accounting Task Force on the IASB's project on financial statement presentation

Policy conception, negotiation and implementation (banking and insurance supervision, primarily in the areas of accounting, auditing, governance and acceptable forms of capital); co-author of governance regulation for banks
profile_positions.title: Senior policy officer (senior beleidsmedewerker)

profile_positions.description:
Various national and international audits, including coordinating and executing audits of consolidated IFRS financial statements; clients included Tetra Laval and ABN AMRO investment funds and subsidiaries of mainly US and Japanese companies.

Special assignments included the investigation and valuation of the power supply in Armenia (European project) and providing support in the acquisition of a production facility in Russia (client project).

1985-1989: qualification as Chartered Accountant at Arthur Young, Cambridge, UK.
profile_positions.title: Senior audit manager
